meanings.sent1: The scientist observed the cells nucleate around the central core.
meanings.sent2: The crystal nucleated around the tiny speck of dust.
meanings.sent3: The students watched the group nucleate into smaller study teams.
meanings.sent4: Her idea nucleated in his mind, growing into a full-fledged plan.
meanings.sent5: The raindrops nucleated on the window, forming intricate patterns.

meanings.definition: To act as a nucleus for.
meanings.sent1: The community center nucleates various events for the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The small town nucleated around the bustling market square.
meanings.sent3: The friendly dog seemed to nucleate all the neighborhood pets around him.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude nucleated a sense of optimism among her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The old tree nucleated a small ecosystem of birds and insects around it.

meanings.definition: To begin to develop or grow.
meanings.sent1: The idea began to nucleate in his mind after the inspiring lecture.
meanings.sent2: The small business nucleated slowly but steadily over the years.
meanings.sent3: The excitement in the room seemed to nucleate as the concert drew closer.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for art nucleated into a successful career as a painter.
meanings.sent5: The seed nucleated into a beautiful flower, blooming in the spring sun.
